body.name: A Mail-Order Bride's Hidden Legacy: An Inspirational Romance Novel
body.description: Amidst the sprawling American frontier, Charlotte "Lottie" Turner inherits not only her father's vast ranch and fortune, but also an ominous predicament following his sudden demise. Determined to break free from the stifling expectations of her small town, Lottie bravely places an ad for a mail-order groom, seeking a partner who appreciates her for the resilient woman she is, beyond the veil of inherited wealth.Little does she know that the rugged terrain conceals shadows harboring a danger that could threaten not just her legacy, but the very fabric of her newfound independence...Responding to Lottie's cryptic call, Will Harrison, a war-weary veteran with an enigmatic past, arrives with concealed motives. Tasked with solving the mystery of his missing brother, he infiltrates the frontier town through a marriage of convenience. However, fate guides him to Lottie's ranch, and an instant connection sparks, binding them in a journey that goes beyond the mystery he initially sought to unravel.Will their intertwined secrets withstand the harsh challenges of the frontier, though?As Lottie and Will navigate the challenges of their shared existence, an unexpected and genuine bond blossoms, defying the covert intentions that brought them together. Yet, as their love deepens with each passing day, a precarious revelation awaits in the shadows. Will they be able to confront the hidden perils that lurk in the untamed wilderness? Or will they let their tale become a riveting journey of survival into the allure of the unknown?"A Mail-Order Bride's Hidden Legacy" is a historical romance novel of approximately 80,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The setting is during 1872 in Bensen, Texas for this heartwarming western romance. On the day of Lottie’s father’s funeral, her nemesis Vincent Leoni threatened to take the ranch. The intrigue begins. Lottie’s friend, Abigail suggested mail order husband as a way of protection.William Harrison left with his father to join war effort at age 16. Now, he is searching for his brother, James since the Civil War ended and his release. James didn’t stay in California and his last letter is postmarked Bensen, Texas. When he reads Lottie’s advertisement in the newspaper his plan begins.Shady lawyer and continued threats to Lottie about ranch force her hand to wed Will. Will is an honorable person wanting to protect Lottie and find his brother. “You’ve got two choices in life – be a victim or be a warrior” is Will’s statement to Lottie. Their love for each other was budding, but ranch is now dealing with criminal gang and continued threats to Lottie’s ranch. Will is thinking ‘he had been pouring his efforts into futile pursuit when the sense of belonging he sought was right there, in the ranch, with Lottie’.Does Will find James? Can Lottie and Will overcome the threats from Vincent Leoni? Need to read story for the exciting whopping finale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lottie and Will
reviews.reviewText: Lottie has had many struggles so far in her young life, her mother died when Lottie was born, and now Lottie is a fully grown woman, and her father has just died. She feels very alone and sad. She has spent her whole life working their ranch with her father, but now she must do it alone. There is a terrible family in town that is trying to get her ranch, by any means. Lottie decides to put in an ad for a mail order husband, so she can have some support. Will answers that ad. He was in the civil war and has an injured leg. He's been looking for his brother for years but has had no success. The last place he was seen was in Benson Texas, the same town Lottie has advertised for a mail order husband. He figures this is a good way for him to seek out his brother. Oh boy is he surprised when Lottie is beautiful, smart, and rich. They are attracted to each other immediately. This is a very good read, by Lilah Rivers. I read it in a day since I couldn't put it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lottie and Will
reviews.reviewText: This sweet romance involves Lottie, seeking a mail order groom in hopes he will help save her family’s ranch. Will arrives with his own dramatic secrets and agenda. Together, they battle challenges that tests their endurance and personal strengths. How will they deal with each others secrets? Will complete strangers be able to find romance? This is a wonderful story, and the author does a great job perfectly depicting the life in the west in the 1800’s, and the burdens they have to endure to survive. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The story of family
reviews.reviewText: Lottie was left the ranch and inherited enough for her to be called wealthy. Will is an ex-Army officer who fought along side his father, who died in the war.. His only remaining relative is his brother. He lost track of his brother while in the hospital for his crushed leg. They marry to protect the ranch, a marriage of convenience. Will they find true love in the midst of everything else going on in their lives?A good read, enough twists and turn to keep my interest to finish the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Both are hiding something
reviews.reviewText: Lottie's ad for a mail-order husband doesn't tell everything about her situation and Will comes not planning anything permanent. He is trying to find a long lost brother whose last known location was her town. She needs a man to help her fight another local rancher determined to buyout everyone by any means possible.Their two issues become intertwined in some unexpected ways as their feelings deepen despite reluctance on both their parts. How can they reconcile these issues without tearing them apart?

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good prevails in this story
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed getting to know all the characters, the good and bad ones. This story had a twist to the mail order storyline. There was excitement, romance and tragedy. This was a definite page turner for me. The extended epilogue was the completion to the story. I volunteered to give an honest review of an Advanced Reader Copy.
